It's a fun game that doesn't take itself too seriously. Cartoonish yet vibrant graphics and smooth gameplay make it a good choice if I want to mindlessly kill some computer generated enemies that scale in difficulty over time. 

As a rouge-like game it might take a little bit of getting used to in terms of how to survive long enough on each survivor (character) to accumulate enough gold and get items. When you start the game as a new player you wont have a lot of options in terms of what types of items will drop, what types of enemies will spawn, and other variables that can change each play through. 

There are online guides that will help you unlock these options, and an online multiplayer mode where you can play with others that have already unlocked those perks. 

I'm looking forward to buying the next expansion when it comes out.

Pork Vindaloo Recipe

Ingredients

15 dried Kashmiri chiles (see note)
2 teaspoons toasted whole cumin seeds
2 teaspoons turmeric
2 (1-inch) pieces of cinnamon
9 whole black peppercorns
7 whole cloves
1 teaspoon sugar
10 garlic flakes (or 2 medium cloves garlic, roughly chopped)
1 inch-piece ginger, peeled and roughly chopped
1/2 cup palm vinegar, or 1/3 cup rice vinegar
1/2 pound pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes
Kosher salt
1 medium onion, roughly chopped (about 1 cup)
1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 cup water

Directions

Combine chilies, cumin, turmeric, 1 piece of cinnamon, 5 peppercorns, 4 cloves, and sugar in a spice grinder. Grind until a fine powder is formed. Transfer spice mixture to food processor or mortar and pestle and add garlic, ginger, and vinegar. Process or pound until a fine paste is formed. Scrape out paste into a small bowl and set aside without washing food processor.


Place pork in a large bowl and season with salt. Add half of spice paste and turn pork to coat. Add onion to food processor and process until a paste is formed.


Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onion paste (do not wash food processor bowl), remaining 4 peppercorns, remaining cinnamon stick, and remaining 3 cloves. Cook, stirring constantly, until onion is soft and oil is fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add remaining spice paste and cook, stirring occasionally, until the oil separates and mixture starts to sizzle, about 5 minutes longer.

Add pork and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 10 minutes. Add water to the food processor bowl and swirl to rinse. Pour mixture into pan and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer, cover, and cook until the pork is fork tender, about 1 hour longer. Serve immediately with bread or rice, or for better flavor, cool, store overnight in a sealed container in the refrigerator, and reheat before serving.

Easy to play, tough to master. This game takes just enough brain power that I still have to think while playing, but I can also just zone out and listen to music or talk with friends.

The visuals are quite brain tickling, the cell shaded world littered with hundreds of enemies at once all being hit or moving or dead on the ground is just something I cannot get over. it is just so nice looking! I want more of it!
Gameplay wise, it gets a bit repetitive, I recommend not spending hours on end playing this game without breaks inbetween, or you'll just lose interest.

Overall, one of my favorite games to date, 9/10, definitely worth a shot.

The amount of content RoR2 has is insane. I really like the diversity in characters and how different each one feels. Each has their own skillsets that provide unique gaming experiences. Next to that, there are so many items that I have not seen quite a few of them after 11,5 hours of playtime. The different items compliment different characters, which ensures you actually have to pay attention to your build. The visuals in this game are stunning and the different maps feel distinct to one another. I have mostly played multiplayer up to this point and it works quite well. I could experience the DLC content in multiplayer a little bit since my partner has it. I am definitely getting it in the future, since it adds so much to the base game. I would recommend to get some quality of life mods to optimise the gaming experience though. I am very new to the RoR franchise but am already falling in love with it.
A very unique shooter where every character is incredibly mechanically interesting.

After 500 hours, I can safely say this is a good game. Jokes aside, this is seriously one of the greatest games IMO that I've ever played. You will be on a 60 minute god run and be flying along like the literal embodiment of war, then get slammed for all  your hp by a brass contraption because you weren't paying attention. The cast of characters for you to play is highly varied, with each "survivor" having a unique playstyle. This keeps it fresh, play a glass cannon, super-agile archer like huntress then switch to a beefy tank with loads of aoe and in your face melee combat.  Farming the achievements is rewarding, because your items you have unlocked in the game are linked to this, and also allows you to farm the in game mods. If you really want challenge and monsoon isn't enough punishment, you have eclipse to really spank you. You WILL notice your skill drastically improve over a short time, a super fun party game if you like screeching with your friends on discord. Now with SoTV expansion, you also have simulacrum which is a wave based game mode. You couldn't ask for a better product for what you're paying for, and  you will always come back to play a few runs of this game, even after a long break.

So after playing this game in early access and a lot after launch I really don't like this game for the same exact reasons that I don't like the first game.
Items don't tell you what they do, a very minor gripe I have compared to the main issue the entire series has.
Damage is just nebulous and health bars are absurd, be it your own or your enemies health bars, or damage. The numbers are just obscenely high and every run of this game becomes Diablo 3 where I'm just spamming attacks at a huge health bar enemy while I desperately hope I don't get hit once within this actual 10 minute boss fight. Apparently that's what people like about this game, that the damage numbers are crazy and there are just particle effects everywhere, but I can't see my character, or my enemy (only their health bar on the ui which is going down very slowly) and I don't know what is going on or why I should get gear. The minute runes got unlocked for me I just lost interest in this game because I'm just only going to use rune of command and I'm only going to pick the best items in the game that make me win, and then I'm going to crush this game with no resistance, the only thing challenging about it being that it's trying my patience. Oh and if I don't want to have the problem where I'm overpowered and crushing everything I'll just play on Monsoon difficulty where everything kills you in one hit and enemies STILL have obscenely large health bars. This is just one of those games like Vermintide 2 where a good difficulty setting just doesn't exist, it's always too hot or too cold it reeks. I just don't understand this game or why you'd want to play a game with stats and damage numbers where they just mean nothing, idk why you would ever want to play Diablo 3, that game sucks. At least you can aim in this game and jump around but it still plays like f'cking diablo 3.
This game is just anti-game balancing and it's not hard or easy it's just boring. I really wanted to love this game and the first one, and when I first played this game I thought "wow they fixed it, the game is fun now" but in retrospect I'm thinking that's just because I was enjoying the 3d take on the game and how the game controls. I actually like the combat in this game a lot it's just numbers that suck. I am desperately, eagerly awaiting a Deadbolt sequel, that is your best game Hopoo games, please make another stealth action game that doesn't have numbers. I know you can make a fun game, this game has fun controls at the least, but just don't have numbers, please god don't make an RPG, don't make Risk of Rain 3, just make a fun game that controls well, no damage, no upgrades, this isn't your Forte after doing it with Risk of Rain, Risk of Rain 2 and Risk of Rain remake the re-riskening or whatever it's called. This ain't it guys. I love the music though, please keep giving Chris Christodoulou work, he is the best thing about Risk of Rain.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Multiplayer is not good

System-wise:
- no quick queue. You have to search for a lobby manually with no auto-refresh
- no way to reconnect after dc
- ping not displayed in lobby

Gameplay-wise:
- stupid that you have to fight with other players for the loot when playing with randoms
- only way to continue playing after dying is to wait for the other players to finish the stage, which can take up to 10min if you get an unfortunate early death. Having to wait for so long is not fun. With little effort the devs could come up with a better revive mechanic that doesn't waste the player's time so much...

Edit after another 36 hours:
- Servers are not good. Random disconnects and lags.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

This is my personal favorite rogue like ever. It's fun by itself even if you don't like rogue likes because gameplay is just that good. It's such a shame that the latest game they released went back to 2d format. Ror2 stumbled onto gold and they completely ignored it.

I love the items and characters in this game. Each plays significantly different and items have major impact making you a lot stronger, but you'll always be at risk of dying if you overstay. Each zone or level is really scenic with its own unique atmosphere.

Ror 2 just did so many things right. When I play other newer rogue likes a lot of my criticism is that they don't implement elements of Ror2. Most notably the increasing difficulty timer that encourages players not to overstay or speedrun beyond their skill level. I also love that Ror2 is not afraid to let you ascend to godhood with infinite looping and infinitely stacking items. Not enough games are willing to give their players that power fantasy and in this case it's well earned in longer runs. 

Modding isn't something to be ignored either. You can play as drip Goku or even Tristana from league of legends.

A fantastically balanced roguelike with seemingly endless replayability. The game gives you everything you need to learn and grow, from selectable difficulty to artifacts that can make your runs easier or harder. Add on top of that the eclipse game mode, and you have a game that can easily eat away your time faster than you thought possible. The only downside is that the Survivors of the Void DLC adds 2 characters that are borderline broken, but these characters mix up the gameplay loop enough that they seem fresh and new, not pay-to-win. With the next DLC announced, this game is only going to get better. Worth full price, every day. Cannot recommend it enough.

Great game to sink some time into. Very fun and interactive with multiple chracters to fit your play style. I highly recommend picking up the DLC for this as it adds even more items and levels to explore. Very similar to a zombies play style. You run around, kill monsters, earn money, spend money on chests to receive items. Lets not forget that there is more than just chests to peak your interest. Shrines of all kinds await for you to find. It is an incredibly satisfying game that doesn't block content if your playing on a lower level (at least in my experience). The only benefit of beating the game on the hardest difficulty (monsoon) is that you then unlock a skin for that survivor.

Also the modded community is wonderful.

Can be very frustrating compared to the 2d version.
Half of attacks and enemies come from off-screen, meaning you cannot react to them - but the design and difficulty of enemies has not significantly changed.
Unlike Slay the Spire, which gives you numbers when you are about to be hit, or Hades, which gives you multiple tries, it is entirely possible to be one-shot by threats you did not expect.
The weapons also feel very pathetic. That is by design, so that your powerups feel even better. But it does not help if you struggle to get anywhere, because of these aforementioned issues.
These are not unsolvable issues and they do not destroy the game. But why would I recommend it when they've released a significantly better clone?

A deeply regrettable and forgettable experience. 

Lacking any clear form of progression or advancement, you play entirely at the whim of the random item generator in the hopes of getting a combo of items that might let you move forward. Mostly you won't, instead finding yourself spending money only to get something that does nothing for your build, or wants to replace something you already have. 

Several broken interactions exist, like 3D printers that take a random one of your items to produce another item, even when you specifically have the trash the 3D printer is supposed to take instead of your actually useful stuff. 

A middling entry into the genre at best, and I can't even say it's worthwhile on sale.

Edit 3: i beat the game at about 25 hour mark i think. It was fun ngl, but it takes a lot to get into the game in the first place. I guess that is the side-effect of playing a rogue-lite. I want to get back to it, as it was fun and i know there are still other mysteries to unlock, i do not know if there is a point to it or not. I do recommend others if they want to play the game but at a stretch is harmful for me, i get addicted beating a vitual game not for story but just to beat the game.

Edit 2: I am 18 hours in, playing on drizzle or beginner difficulty, and as i can explore more even tho I bosses are much easier, I have to say i like the game to some extent. Gaining cool powers and different bats, drones and other familiars that accompany me through my journey is fun. I have to say tho that i wish the story was something i did not have to want to go looking for but i understand the design choice of not bothering people who dont care about it much, It is a good game for people who enjoy rogue-lite and got the time.

Edit 1: This is 3 hours later, I am 10 hours in, after I decreased the difficulty to beginner so that i could understand what the game actually is like and defeating first 3 bosses, 3 events and special places, i can say that yes, i get the appeal. the game felt bad at first maybe but not anymore honestly, guess i just suck at it also my pc sucked so set my graphics to low and now i can play well. My initial review of the game being a hollow experience, while it stands on what i based it on, as i mentioned, with bit of time invested I understood the appeal, tho it happened faster than what i was expecting. game is not bad. will update if any thing more change.

this was my first time playing a 3rd person rogue-lite. while starting i could not see much story and not sure when will. so for me it has been mindlessly killing things that attack me. Someone said this game is a persuit of a power-fantasy which may describe many roguelites but this one in particular does match as i could not find anything else worthwhile to do. I think this is a game for people who like roguelite for the sake of the challenge and like the experience in 3D.

for me personally if i am to get into this game i would have to see what is here, then would just get sucked into it just to beat it without really any other motivation, as my body and mind is not craving such an endeavor, i want to say this game is not for me at this moment, maybe when it came out 3 years ago but not now, maybe i took too long to play it, but maybe someday.

The game ran well enough in singleplayer on my core i5 7gen pc with no gfx card and 12gb ram, but had trouble in multiplayer co-op, maybe it was because i was hosting but i could not confirm this as playmate uninstalled after one session. 

i am 7 hours in and I wished it had more story and would have given some breathing space, it is hard for new players to get used to what the world is and what is happening, needed time to figure out what, why and... why(?). so the more time you give it the more you like it coz you are exerting effort but it was effort to understand a game that has little semblance with the real world and so i feel reluctant to get into it in one go as it feels like  a chore for nothing, maybe i feel like that about everything now, maybe i am getting older or maybe it is just the stress but it feels to much to get into and so the game feels hollow at times, maybe this would change with time when i get better at this game i would start to enjoy it, I think that says a lot about me than it says about the game.

Maybe i will change/add to this review someday

Jul 29 2020 Review:
Risk of Rain 2 is one of those games that you can play repeatedly, get bored of after a week, then pick it up again in a couple of days once again. 

For an early access game rapidly approaching 1.0 release, it is truly an experience that is seldom rivaled in the market of roguelike Third Person Shooter. Hopoo games has done an incredible job listening to the community, and truly cares about the progress and sheen of their game, to an almost Blizzardesque level. 

If you enjoy a cast of interesting characters with a variety of play styles and functions, Third Person Shooters, as well as an active dev team and a rapidly growing community, ROR2 is for you!

2024 Review (Post release + Pre DLC 2) 

-This game has only gotten better, and if the steam reviews do not convince you to purchase, the sheer number of hours of gameplay loops should.

-If you have any interest in roguelikes, pick this game up, as well as its DLC. I have played for over 230 hours, and I still have not unlocked all there is in the main game or DLC.

-I once again stress how worth this game is, and oh by the way, it consistently goes on sale, though it is worth full price regardless

-Still HIGHLY recommend

I would recommend this game to anyone. Great gameplay, thirteen characters to choose from, amazing soundtrack as you play, great maps for you to survive on, and a plenty of items for you to choose between making each run different from the last. The co-op in the game is also amazing, allowing you to play with three others to do challenges or just have a good time.

Have some pancakes :)

STEP 1
Put 100g plain flour and a pinch of salt into a large mixing bowl.

STEP 2
Make a well in the centre and crack 2 eggs into the middle.

STEP 3
Pour in about 50ml from the 300ml of semi-skimmed milk and 1 tbsp sunflower oil then start whisking from the centre, gradually drawing the flour into the eggs, milk and oil. Once all the flour is incorporated, beat until you have a smooth, thick paste. Add a little more milk if it is too stiff to beat.

STEP 4
Add a good splash of milk and whisk to loosen the thick batter. While still whisking, pour in a steady stream of the remaining milk. Continue pouring and whisking until you have a batter that is the consistency of slightly thick single cream.

STEP 5
Heat the pan over a moderate heat, then wipe it with oiled kitchen paper.

STEP 6
Ladle some batter into the pan, tilting the pan to move the mixture around for a thin and even layer. Quickly pour any excess batter into the mixing bowl, return the pan to the heat.

STEP 7
Leave to cook, undisturbed, for about 30 secs. If the pan is the right temperature, the pancake should turn golden underneath after about 30 secs and will be ready to turn.

STEP 8
Hold the pan handle, ease a palette knife under the pancake, then quickly lift and flip it over. Make sure the pancake is lying flat against the base of the pan with no folds, then cook for another 30 secs before turning out onto a warm plate.

STEP 9
Continue with the rest of the batter, serving them as you cook or stack onto a plate. You can freeze the pancakes for 1 month, wrapped in cling film or make them up to a day ahead.

Risk of Rain 2 is a fast paced game that knows exactly what it is and embraces it fully. The gameplay loop is simple: Kill enemies, collect items to get stronger, find teleporter, kill more enemies, die, repeat. Many games do this however they tend to lack in most other areas. The simplicity of the game for one is surface level, deeper you'll find a somewhat more complex layer of gameplay, adding to the replayability factor as you can reach different areas depending on what you do for each run. There are no permanent ability modifiers or unlocked areas that persist between runs, everything is available from the start, you just need the skill, luck, and experience to find it. The story knows it doesn't need to be complex, it's very straightforward and fits well into the gameplay. The environment is uniquely designed for each area and hand crafted. The sound design and BGM are absolutely phenomenal and really lock your focus to the game.

But what makes the gameplay itself fun? Completely busted builds. The fun lies in completing challenges to unlock new, truly unique, characters to use, skills for individual characters, and items to drop in the game. Then make the most absolutely broken and unfair build possible. You achieve this by challenging yourself. It takes creativity and knowledge of the items and game system to know what you need, it takes skill to have a chance, and luck to finally make it happen. And to make it easy to learn the system you can see every item you have unlocked in the logbook and its stats. Including how it behaves when you stack it. The crowbar for example gives you +75% damage to enemies at 90% or more health, and you do +75% more damage for each crowbar you have. Meaning 12 crowbars gives you +900% damage on your first shot for any enemy. This is an actual in-game challenge to unlock a new ability for a character. Get in, and go wild. And remember... You're probably not beating the game anytime soon.

Pros:
- Characters are all viable and have unique skill sets that require mastery (some more than others though)

- Janky physics

Here's a basic flow diagram of this game
- drop in
- murder (they started it)
- gamble in more ways than one
- find teleporter
- die to laser/supernova and reset from step 1

- stage 2, standard operation procedure
- die to  s u c c and reset

- stage 3, spend 10 minutes looking for teleporter
- die to bison/5 billion wisps. Reset

- stage 4, triple void seed or 20 billion golems/mushrooms/FUCKING LARVA
- you guessed it
- miss the legendary chest or come up a dollar short after finishing TP

- stage 5
- 3 xi constructs (count em')
- if it's your first time, find the artifact portal before the TP and get the artifact of honor (and then get even more confused when you find yourself at step 1 again)
- if not, you're probably dead but on the off-chance you're not, proceed having not found a scrapper the whole run

- moon
- experience modern warfare
- more teleporters, but this time they're spicy, just like the enemies
- ascend and miss twice
- get challenged to croquet
- he has a bigger hammer, you lost
- if you didn't lose, he reveals his Albanian heritage and beats you at your own game

now you've probably died a ton, and even when you win, you get the eternal glory that no other game can replicate in a style like Risk of Rain can.

you get to start from step 1, again.

Updated Feb 2024:
Alright. I caved and came back to give it another try with some friends. I keep my stance of not liking the new enemies. Especially the stingray looking things and triangle flying dudes that roast you with lasers. The new maps are meh for the most part. Mithrix stage is terrible with all of the charging. The void boss is a neat addition. The parkour feels a little mean until you have some good movement, but I can overlook that. I just finished cleaning up the remaining achievements I was missing since the update. I really like railgunner. W survivor. Bandit isn't bad but kinda feels like a discount Captain. The void survivor feels actually really good, though I wish he had some alternate abilities. The corrupted void items are a nice addition as well;  I really like pretty much all of them. Revising my rating after getting back into it. 

10/10 before SoTV. Now I give it a 9/10.

Updated April 2022:
Man. I used to love this game before the bandit and void updates, but I'm not so sure anymore. The new enemies seem annoying just for the sake of being annoying. No sense of uniqueness is felt with them, just some extra flying enemy that shoots something at you, or this ground enemy that is difficult to target. Final stage has more chores added to it that don't feel great at all. I loved it before all of the unnecessary fluff or "charging" was added to that stage. The new items are interesting as well as the new survivors, but that's about it. This is coming from someone that 100%'d the game in achievements all on monsoon with no artifacts in 1.0. Through all of this I'd still recommend it, but it's no longer a 10/10 for me. 

Updated at 100% achievement completion:
Wow. This game is awesome. I've poured so many hours into learning how to play each character and how to build effective builds. This game is fun solo or with multiplayer. I do both often. The additions with 1.0 are great, and I look forward to the next updates to this awesome game. If you are on the fence about getting this game, do it and enjoy the ride.

Previous review:
This game is a lot of fun with friends. For someone that doesn't typically go for multiplayer fps type games, the characters are varied enough to where I can find something that is fun for my tastes. The items have a lot of variation and bring a rogue-like feel to the game, but it might take you a bit to remember what each item does before you steal it from a teammate that might benefit from it more than you. The enemies are also diverse and fun. You'll pick up on which ones you really hate fast. Overall, a nice pickup.

So as a quick background, I wanted to play this game for a really long time, but never bought it until the most recent steam winter sale. I have to say, this is one of the most fun games I have played in a very long time. It is incredibly fun and enjoyable both alone and with friends. 
The support for modding is fantastic and allows for even more content which is amazing! I also have to say, as someone who loves music to the core, the soundtrack to this game is undeniably impeccable. 
My one and only downside is that the developers rely heavily on the "charge the thing" trope. You need to do it for every stage, the final stage both for the final boss and the boss for SotV DLC..... Not bad, just disappointing that the trope is such a fallback for them. 
Otherwise overall this game blew my expectations out of the water!

First off, great game. Not recommending it doesn't mean I feel its bad.
This is a rogue-lite about getting big with ludicrous numbers. Period. At least half of the encounters in this game cannot be excused for being balanced the way it is unless the idea is to stat-check everything not you.

Risk of Rains 2 is overwhelming disheartening in the start. If you are looking to buy this game, make sure you have guides or have someone to piggyback with. The unlock-able characters and a fair bit of the alternative powers are not worth the effort in the slightest, especially since one of the best characters in the game is given to you at level 1. 

You will not find a balanced experience. The balance is becoming overwhelmingly powerful that the thousands of enemies have no chance, or be murdered down and resent to the lobby. 

The character designs and kits are where most of the enjoyment comes from, aside enjoying breaking the systems. So, it may sound contradictory to my earlier statement, but I can assure you that most of these characters are not worth the effort in farming up a broken build, die to a random enemy you've never seen before like a Jailer, restart, get bad items, restart, get kicked because you are running cross-play with a friend and get the super common lobby breaking glitch, restart and maybe, maybe... Maybe you'll get someone you enjoy playing as.

With Risk of Rain 2, you aren't at risk of getting wet, but at Risk of losing 45 minutes of progress to a single hit instead.

When the composer for a game ends up as your 2nd most listened to artist on Spotify in a year you know the music slaps. 9.5/10

Risk of Rain 2 is like trying to juggle flaming torches while riding a unicycle through a minefield - visually stunning, utterly chaotic, and bound to leave you wondering how you ended up in this mess in the first place. With enemies coming at you from all angles and power-ups that range from mildly helpful to downright bonkers (seriously, who thought summoning a lightning storm was a good idea?), it's a whirlwind adventure where survival is as likely as finding a needle in a haystack. Grab your weapons, pray for luck, and prepare to question your life choices as you navigate through this colorful circus of confusion.

Absolutely endless hours of fun. First learning the game as a beginner, working my way from easy difficulty to Very Hard, then starting my Eclipse climb and ascending the 8 tiers of ungodly horrors. Even with over 400 hours I still have room to improve my gameplay, still have new mechanics and interactions to discover and learn. This is one of my favourite games of all time, and even when I play it to death and take a break, if a friend asks me to run some games with them I am always excited, as it adds so many more shenanigans and fun ways to play. Highly recommend this to all gamers, not just rogue-like enjoyers. The replay-ability is immense and with new DLC around the corner of this review, I anticipate thousands more hours of enjoyment,

One of the most enjoyable rogue-likes I've ever played, The gameplay loop is easy to develop an understanding of and becoming decent at the game is no major struggle, but mastering the game can be a bit time consuming with understanding how proc chains and proc chances work. I love how the game formats achievements to directly link to unlocking new characters and items, makes it feel as though every run has a secondary goal. I strongly recommend everyone to try out the game at least a couple of times, especially with friends. Looking forward to the upcoming DLC. Only major weak point is how the story feels disconnected from the gameplay besides a few special interactions.

TLDR; This a really fun, well-made, rouge-like that really shines when played with friends. If you're looking for something to grind with the homies. You just found it.

Graphics 4/5:
Although the graphics aren't anything thats going to make the headlines. I really enjoy the style and it suits the game perfectly. The only reason this didnt get a 5 is because the game is a bit older and the graphics could be a bit more refined or updated but no loss of enjoyment here at all.

Sound 4/5:
The score/soundtrack to this game is absolutely incredible. As a musician I love when a game is scored by someone that obviously took a lot of pride(and rightfully so) in the work they did on the project. At times the SFX can be kind of overwhelming simply because of the amount of things happening at once, but thats just the nature of the game.

Gameplay 5/5:
I have no *real* complaints here. Of course I will throw out criticisms from time to time during gameplay but who doesn't do that after you've played a game for 80+ hours? Truth is, I picked this game up on a whim just to have something to play with buddies and got sucked in so much more than I would've expected. It is just absolutely good classic co-op fun. Well balanced and thought out from beginning to end.

Story 2/5:
I was actually tempted to omit this category simply do to it being irrelevant. Instead I've decided to include a new category to prevent the score drop.

Wildcard 2/0:
Never expected this game to be so great, but it really is, so they get a couple of extra points I wouldn't normally include.

Total score: 17/20 (Highly Recommend)

i got this game at a horrible moment yet i still enjoyed it. i got this game after it lost its popularity and nobody was playing it anymore and poor younger me didn't know and bought the game because i wanted to have fun with other people. i got the game and played singleplayer to understand most of the basics and i got to moment where i was doing very good runs and lose everytime in the end. i then went to the multiplayer section to see if anyone could help me  out to get better or to just beat the game  for once but i find nothing but an empty void with no one left to play. i was so sad to see that i bought this game specifically to play with other people and no one was around anymore. Even though i spent money to buy this game, even though no one was around to play this game anymore, even though i couldn't refund this game, i still think it was worth buying this game because you never know what might happen in the future. i pray that the devs update or remaster  the game so old players  or even new people come back to the game  to play. i just want to to have that one reason why i bought this game and so i can finally play the game the way i attended originally.

While not a bad game, Risk of Rain 2 is definitely frustrating and has some major flaws. It's fairly repetitive compared to other rougelike games (only a small handful of bosses, characters, maps, and items with mostly boring effects), and the gameplay leaves something to be desired. Half the time you're sitting and waiting for stuff to spawn, the other half you have a billion enemies after you constantly. Dying doesn't feel like a lack of skill half the time, as trying to dodge dozens of beams, fireballs, and other projectiles that do half your health each just isn't fun and usually ends in unavoidable death, not to mention Malachite elites just outright oneshot you if you decide to loop. Most of the bosses aren't that great either, most evaporate your health if you can't dodge or hide behind cover, and unless your run is really good, they can take a good while to kill. As for characters and items, most characters want very specific item builds, which makes the heavy item RNG suck to work with, even with Printers and Scrappers. And plenty of high rarity items aren't even that good, and a good amount of the items in the game don't even feel noticeable or all that helpful. All things considered, Risk of Rain isn't that bad of a game, but there's definitely better rougelikes out there

Absolutely the best roguelike game out there, bar none, especially with the amazing multiplayer aspect in mind. Everything from the artstyle, the lore and the endless renewal in gameplay, plus just the weird/cool/mysterious vibe it all has. And maybe most importantly, the composer of the soundtrack is a downright genius (I'm a proud owner of both RoR2 vinyls). 
I'm over 200 hours in and I feel like I haven't even experienced a third of what this game has to offer.

Adore this game. Never really been into roguelikes, but this game just does it superbly. Can be very challenging and a little grindy for achievements/unlocks, but I still had a great time doing them and couldn't put the game down. If you have never played a roguelike before and you like third person shooters, then this game is a perfect starting point. And a new dlc is coming soon with Seekers of the Storm, so it's a game that is still receiving love and attention years after release. Can get it for a little cheaper on G2A with a key, so I recommend doing that. Buy it now.

Risk of rain 2 is a success on multiple fronts, a fantastic indie game that proves that gaming isn't dead from a dev that respect their product and audience. We have a game here that;

- transitioned perfectly from a 2d side scroller into a 3rd person shooter. Bigger games have tried less risky ventures only to fail and fade into obscurity, whilst risk of rain shows it can conquer both the 2nd and 3rd dimensions flawlessly.

- has established itself as one greatest rougelikes ever made, it is a beautiful blend of hardcore whilst also being approachable. Death can come quick and hours of progress can be lost in a flash but you'll be back in a run in a matter of seconds hitting crazy power levels.

- and finally has a dev team that not only puts out high quality dlc and support for a game they clearly love making but they also cherish the community they have built.

I have nothing bad to say about this game, it's one of my favourite rougelikes with countless hours logged across all systems it's avaliable on, the graphics are pleasing, the game controls like butter and the ost slaps hard. 

This is a game I strongly suggest everyone play but especially those that may be intimated by genre, I started with this game and have never looked back, it's the best starting and end point, you will be craving more when you've blasted passed your 100th hour but you will still come back for more.

Timless masterpiece and proof that in the years of decline from AAA studios we can still have indie devs to save the day.

Check out thunderstore io for RoR2 mods, some are even vanilla compatible so you can fix the issues I had with the game via mods & still play with your unmodded friends. Though you will need to do the prismatic trials to unlock the scythe & Merc's ability before you start playing modded as the prismatic trials are not available while modded.
__________________
Mods I run (these all work with vanilla):
UmbraLandinPods (Makes doppelgangers show up via drop pod, giving you time to react.)
ItemBlacklist (Disable items you really don't like.)
StartBonusMod (Gives starting money & items on the first stage speeding up the process.)
GoldChestForAll (No more fighting for reds.)
TeleporterShowRedux (Teleporter stays pinged.)
EasyLocateTeleporter (I'd set it to around 30 seconds.)
TeleExpansion  (Allows you to speed up teleporters by setting their multiplier below 1)
BetterGameplay (Teleports loot that fell off the map onto the ground.)
LunarCoinShareOnPickup (Shares lunar coins.)
DropInMultiplayer (Lets your friends /join_as whichever mid-game.)
QuickRestart (Restart the run or return to character select much faster.)
VoidCellRevive (Revive after every completed cell.)
BossVengenceRevive (Revive teammates from a finished teleporter event, boss kill, or vengeance artifact doppelganger kill.)
PillarRevive  (Spawns a Mithrix pillar where your friend died, that when you charge it respawns your friend.)
SacrificeTweaks (Up the drop rate with artifact of sacrifice.)
MoreSacrificeInteractables (Equipment barrels, Lunar Pods, & Void stuffs spawn with sacrifice on.)
BossesDropItems (Personal Favorite, allows you to guarantee loot on a boss kill, very helpful for multiplayer.)
PressureDrop (Buttons are held down on Aqueduct, & you can drop items for friends with /drop itemname.)
LobbyVotesSave (Saves your artifact choices.)
EmptyChestsBeGone (Removes looted chests.)
_______________

After playing this game again and pretty much experiencing every character, I can say that Risk of Rain 2, sadly isn't better than the first one.
By no means I mean "This is a bad game", it still is a very fun game and even better with friends, but i'd say it kinda falls short compared to the first one. The change to 3D is cool, but it takes away some of the charm the original game had (and with the recent RoR Returns release, this only got more apparent), while the first game is more simple and compact, generating a more satisfying experience, this one flips on that entirely and tries to do too much and hits too little. What do i mean by that? A lot of characters are very hit or miss; some item pickups are entirely outclassed by others or just straight up useless (and don't even get me started on how the DLC is just paid access to the best items and characters in the game); going for more lengthy runs feels heavy discouraged, with the ammount of enemies that can just straight up one shot you (Elite Greater Wisps, Brass Contraptions, Void enemies (which explode on death, and literally deletes you if u stay in the explosion radius), etc.) or can lead to one shots (Yes, we all hate Malachite Elites here). 
Overall, still worth the purchase if you like the series and specially if you have friends to play with, but I'd still take the first game (Or RoR Returns, which is just a better version of the first game) over this one.
Also, BUY THE DLC, IT HAS THE BEST ITEMS IN THE GAME, YOU ARE LITERALLY CRIPPLING YOURSELF BY NOT HAVING IT.

I personally prefer Risk of Rain Returns and the original game over this sequel. This game is much less challenging and requires me to "make my own fun" to keep the game from becoming in later levels. There is lots to discover and unlock, but ultimately the disappointing endings don't make this a super replayable game for me, especially due to the lack of challenge on Monsoon difficulty. While Eclipse difficulty definitely ups the challenge, I hate the way that those changes are implemented, which makes certain items, strategies and characters irrelevant at the highest level.

If you don't like roguelikes, try this, let me explain why.
Risk of Rain 2 is a very unique roguelike experience; with difficulty not only changing the actual difficulty, but playstyle and strategy. There's enough characters and loadouts for every player to enjoy and diverse enemies and maps. The loot pool takes time to get a feel for but still provides opportunities to newer players. There's also immense replayability and even lore. The game is incredible to challenge yourself, relax, or  play with friends and is overall just a really refreshing experience. 10/10, highly recommend

Hark! Behold the marvel that is Risk of Rain 2, a digital realm where players embark upon a quest profound, where the terrestrial meets the celestial in a cosmic ballet of chaos and camaraderie. From the very moment thou art cast upon yon alien soil, the game ensnares thy senses in a realm both perilous and promising.

Lo and behold the transformation from two-dimensional visage to the grandeur of a three-dimensional expanse! It doth not merely replicate the progenitor but elevates it, endowing players with vistas both breathtaking and dynamically shifting, as they traverse a realm shaped by the capricious hand of procedural design.

At the heart of this digital masquerade lies the essence of cooperative multiplayer, where not mere camaraderie, but essential collaboration doth ensure survival. The interplay betwixt characters and the strategic alchemy of item affinities render each odyssey unique, a kaleidoscope of challenge and reward.

Risk of Rain 2, with adept aplomb, straddles the delicate line betwixt accessibility and profundity. Whether thou art seasoned in gaming's art or a neophyte to the roguelike genre, the intuitive reins and gradual ascent ensure an experience delightful for all. The myriad characters, each endowed with unique faculties, tempt the player into varied exploits and ever-changing playstyles.

Visually, the game unfolds as a veritable feast for discerning eyes. The vibrant artistry, a harmonious dance of hues, complements the tumultuous nature of play, creating a visual spectacle that commands admiration. The meticulous detail, both in the design of characters and the mise-en-scène, contributes to an immersive tapestry.

In conclusion, Risk of Rain 2 doth stand as a paragon of roguelike artistry. Its engaging cooperative play, visually resplendent stage, and inherent replayability beckon both seasoned and novice alike. Be it a solitary sojourn or a fellowship forged in pixels, the game unfolds as an epic saga, a theatrical tapestry of Fortune's dance. Prepare thyself for an odyssey both stirring and memorable.

Alright, I've played 61 hours, but I still think I should write a review,
I think ROR2 (Risk of Rain 2) is one of the best second person combat game ever created. It was pretty hard at first, but then I realized EXACTLY how to beat the game. Understand what your main character needs, get the artifact of command, get the stuff, beat the game, unlock new characters, repeat (except steps #1, 2 and 6).
I say this to the makers of this game, you guys are one of the best game programmers there are.

This is a really fun game, would definitely recommend it. the mechanic of changing difficulty and changing your character is fun and will always guarantee a fun playthrough every time. 

some problems with it are you have to actively speedrun it or it will get disproportionately difficult, which can be hard as you spend 10 minutes searching for the teleporter. also, the bosses are not very difficult, and some are not enjoyable.

This game can also feel repetitive, but having multiple characters can remedy that.

Honestly 8.5/10, would definitely recommend.

This game is such a blast, LOVE the Music (Especially character select and Stage 5) and the challenging quest to 100% the game. (Currently at 89%)
The Items are very fun to experiment with other or specific items for your selected character. And the multiplayer is also nice to bring even more chaos.

If there were any changes I personally would like to see is if they could add a few more stages, like 2 or 3 would be fine. Another change is to implement a Day/Night cycle. Like a 50/50 chance to occur on a stage. And well, because of the title. Rain. Make it Rain in some of the grasslands/forest stages. Again, by chance.

And since I play Risk of Rain Returns, I would love to see Enforcer back. My main.
Adding some new moves to characters such as Captain's secondary would be nice.

As of writing this, there is also a DLC coming out. Don't know when or what its about but its nice to see this game receive an update, Yay.

Risk of rain 2 is one of the best games i have ever played. I could play this game for the rest of my life on and off. Its definitely the best Rougelike that i have personally ever played. I would highly recommend this game to anyone that wants a incredible game for Playing alone or playing with friends. Some of my favorite things include:
The music is incredible and ramps up with the gameplay as you go.
The character selection is large and covers alot of different kind of play styles.
The game is still being updated to add more maps,characters and items.
The graphical style is unique in the way the textures fit with the colors.
Each map has its very own style, theres one with snow, Lava, Water, Sand, and many more things.
The amount of items is staggering, no 2 runs are the same.
There are artifacts that are basically add ons in the game that allow for you to make the game harder or easier... but mostly harder.
The lore of the game is very interesting. (Even though i never looked into it)
The bosses of the game are very cool and challenging when learning the game.
The learning curve alone probably took me 50-100 hrs to learn properly.
Theres so many more things that i love about this game but I dont really want to make a review so horribly long. 
The things i dislike include:
Personal shield generator
Cronobauble
Clay templars (i do like them they are just strong)
I dont really have any complaints with the game. In my personal opinion the game is well worth the money. I would buy it again if i had to. This game to me is a good 9.25/10

The BEST game i ever seen.

 - MUSIC: This game have an EPIC soundtrack, music that made me to listen out of the game. Thanks for Chris Christodoulou.
(9,5/10)

 - ART: A BEAUTIFUL art style and graphics. Every item that you pick will be added to your character, the maps and the environment really matches with the theme of the game.
(10/10)

- CONTENT: The game has 13 survivors (and the ???), with all having his own all having their own unlockable abilities. Also have 148 itens and 38 equipment in the game. And finally, a BIG lore, that you can find pieces of it, in every single map, item, equipment, character and monster.
(10/10)

 - GAMEPLAY: Each character offer his own abilities of mobility, damage and/or support. You certainly will find your type.
(10/10)

 - DLC: The first one (DLC) is incredible. 2 of the 13 survivors are from DLC, and my favorite survivor are one of these 2. They two have very interesting mechanics and play style. The (The second one (DLC) hasn't launched yet, I will update this review after playing it.)
(9/10)

 - PRICE: Found this on sale? WORTH. Found on full price? Also WORTH. LOL
(9/10)

 - MULTIPLAYER: A really fun game to play with friends. Is hard to balance the itens to everyone be OP, but, why you will share, if you can steal. But in general, it's a good multiplayer, just have good friends, or, be the stealer.
(9/10)

I spent fairly decent amount of time on this game but it wasn't a time that I enjoyed that much. Most of it was just attempts to get good RNG or trying to get achievements to unlocks characters and items (some of them are stupidly grindy).

I will now point out things I disliked the most in this game:

- classes are the same (except a few) and what character you will choose will matter less the more time you will spend on run

- active skills are even worse in that regard: they do not scale well and your left-click attack will be probably better late game

- items completely define your build but because there are so many of them you will end up with mostly the same build regardless

- time is your enemy: you need to run fast and kill fast, everything else will be just inferior option that will not work in this game. I have tried many times to do some tanky/healing builds for fun but they do not belong in this game.

- lack of information: game has fantastic and very informative UI for menu and characters but when the game starts it literally change to the worst experience you will have, no information about items you pick, so you will have to memorize all those items and read about them in main menu

- TABing game doesn't stop time so you are punished for learning the game. You want to check how well items you picked synergize? Well too bad, take those stronger enemies now. Probably the most stupid decision I saw in any game.

this is probably the only heartfelt review i'll ever write.


this game actually changed my life.

maybe a year or two ago when i got this game i honestly had no idea what was going on, but my friend taught me everything there is to know about the game. i was struggling with depression and this game pulled me out of that hole. i played this game nonstop for like a month. 

i can't help but express my deep gratitude for the transformative impact that ror2 had on my life. in the midst of a challenging period marked by depression, this game became a beacon of light, pulling me out of the darkness and into a world of endless possibilities

from the moment I entered the immersive realm of risk of rain 2, I found solace in its captivating landscapes and dynamic gameplay. the breathtaking environments and otherworldly creatures provided a welcome escape from the struggles that weighed heavily on my mind. the game's vibrant colors and intricate design not only engaged my senses but also transported me to a place where joy and excitement were not just possible but inevitable.

the cooperative nature of risk of rain 2 became a lifeline for me. connecting with friends, in the shared pursuit of survival against increasingly challenging odds forged bonds that transcended the digital realm. the collaborative effort required to conquer the game's formidable challenges mirrored the support system I desperately needed in my own life. it became a reminder that, just like in the game, facing adversity together makes us stronger.

one of the game's most remarkable aspects is its unpredictability. the ever-shifting landscapes and the randomness of item drops served as a metaphor for life's unpredictable nature. In embracing the uncertainty within the game, i found the strength to accept and navigate the uncertainties in my own life. risk of rain 2 became a therapeutic experience, encouraging me to adapt, strategize, and ultimately overcome the challenges before me.

beyond its entertainment value, risk of rain 2 taught me invaluable lessons about resilience and the importance of companionship. the game became a source of motivation, pushing me to persevere in the face of adversity. the moments of triumph, whether in defeating a challenging boss or surviving a seemingly impossible situation, mirrored my own journey toward recovery.

in essence, risk of rain 2 was not just a game, it was a lifeline that helped me weather the storm of depression. its immersive world, cooperative gameplay, and lessons in resilience became integral components of my healing process. to the developers and everyone involved in creating this masterpiece, thank you for crafting an experience that goes beyond entertainment and becomes a powerful force for positive change in the lives of those who need it most.

All around amazing game. Top notch art design, game play loop, soundtrack, optimisation, etc. I've gotten an enormous amount of fun out of this game playing both alone and with friends. You can play this game for hundreds of hours before feeling like you've mastered it, and it only takes a run or two to grasp the basics. In my lowly opinion, this game is currently THE best example of what a rogue-like can and SHOULD be. 

There are no arbitrary limits on any items/stats. Meaning if you stack 50 attack speed items it will keep on climbing (albeit with diminishing marginal returns for obvious balancing reasons) to no hard ceiling. Because of this you occasionally get insane and hilarious runs where you have 900% movement speed, or become an immovable tank. There are also no arbitrary impediments to progression. Although it took me a while to learn about the gameplay modifiers called artefacts (like Skulls in Halo), there is nothing stopping someone from unlocking them on their first run. You could hypothetically unlock 5 new characters, 10 new items, and half a dozen artefacts on your first run of the game. One of these artefacts allows you to choose your own items. This changes the game from a rogue-like to something pretty different, where you can just try new builds, or stack 30 of your favourite item, or stack 150 double jumps and nothing else... You get the idea. The artefacts extend the longevity of this game by so much. They really add unique challenges and/ or differences to your runs if you choose to add them, which, btw, can be stacked if you desire. 

The third person shooting feels intuitive, responsive, and overall adds a huge element of fun to the game. In so many rogue-likes you're limited by dinky pixel art sprites slowly travelling across the screen to defeat foes, and if you're lucky these will ramp up into something a bit more fast paced after several upgrades. In this game, there is a mix of snipers, melee brawlers, and rapid fire machine gunners --and more-- that all take the intensity and the immersion up a huge notch. Despite being an indie dev, the responsiveness of the shooting and the overall feel is of the highest quality. And this is coming from a degenerate who wasted all of highschool playing old Call of Duty's. 

This game really takes the best elements of the Rogue-like genre and does away with the stupid and annoying parts we all know too well. The maps are huge, the world has an interesting lore, and the progression feels natural and rewarding. This game would arguably still be worth it at twice the price. I plan to support all future projects this dev produces, and continue playing RoR2 for the foreseeable future.

Everything I love about Risk of Rain 1 but in 3D!! Hopoo did an amazing job of capturing the essence of the original and creating an amazing new experience. Solo runs are great but the fun factor increases when you play with friends. Soundtrack is one of the best you will ever hear in a video game. I listen to it outside of the game all the time.

Multiple content updates later and the game is better than ever. New and interesting items, survivors and enemies keep me coming back for more.

I'm seeing some reviews complain about the game being boring after a couple runs as all you do is run around and kill things. While that is essentially the point of the game, unlocking new characters and items is a nice challenge and adds variety to the game. 

Anniversary update wasn't huge but it added a lot of nice touches and fixes to go along with a new survivor (also a hidden one). They completely revamped the final level making it much more interesting and challenging. Survivors of the void DLC is huge and really well done.

If you want to spend money for about 20-30 hours of enjoyment, go right ahead, but this in general feels very limited, the items can seem interesting at first but stacking items falls off really quickly and there are so many items that are disingenuous (armor repulsion plate) that seem like they should be good, but are straight up trash. There should be more routes for stacking items and mixing up playstyles. The only meta that exists in this game is, attack speed, damage, and movement speed. There could be a lot more variety but the devs limit it so hard, (lysate cell stacking with engineer), Honestly it's a 10/10 at first, but after unlocking a few characters and beating the game, 4/10, probably less.

Risk of Rain 2 manages to create a beautiful world with a unique art style. On top of that, it has an amazing soundtrack composed by Chris Christodoulou. It's one of the best roguelikes of all time, and definitely one of the best co-op roguelikes as well. The game features 11 playable characters in the base game, each with different playstyles. Every character also has unlockable alternative skills to try out and experiment with. Every run is unique due to random loot. You are missing out a lot if you haven't played it yet.

For the cost of the game and DLC, this game is phenomenal. From the fun game-play loop and wide variety of items to the absolutely jam of the music. I originally thought that I would not like it as I tend to not like roguelikes, but that is certainly not the case. My recommendation for new players is to experience the game with no guides to items etc, until you at least beat the base game. Then if you are struggling to go up in difficulty then look more into characters, items, and strategies to beat the game. It is fine to be bad, but do not let other people gate keep your experience with this game; especially those that make fun of the lower difficulties. It is fine to not start off in eclipse...

Very good rougelike and a great game to start getting into the genre. The first dlc is very good as it adds two survivors, various new items, enemies, and final boss. Game is also very good without the dlc so if you want to wait to find out you like the game first before buying the dlc, you'll still get a very well polished game. The base game has various unique survivors to try out a different play style. the game also has a lot of depth from how each item you get stacks, interacts with another item, and how  important an item is to specific survivors. The game's main mechanic of spending more time on a stage making the game harder might seen scary at first, but the game is just looking for the player to learn how to maximizing exploring a stage while getting items and looking for the teleporter to get out of the stage. If you're unsure about enjoying this game, look up some gameplay to see how people play to find out what gameplay loop the game has.

This has been extremely fun. It's a great shooter, with good roguelite mechanics and an air of mystery. I've tried out almost every character at this point, and I have not found one that I dislike. I also checked out the logbook and started reading the stories and journal entries for the enemies, survivors, and equipment, and that was pretty engaging too.

The difficulty is also good in this game. It has something for you if you're just looking to relax, and you can keep on playing for longer if you want to seek out a challenge. 

The only warning that I'd give is that, as a casual player, one run would take me around 40-70 minutes. (40 minutes if I'm just going for the easier content, 70 minutes if I'm looking for more of a challenge.) Admittedly, you can make an effort to run the game faster to decrease this time, but 40 minutes felt like the natural run length for me. You need some time to sit down and play, but if you have the time, it's fantastic.

Great roguelike that uses 3rd person FPS mechanics and virtually unlimited potential with builds. There aren't many roguelikes that allow you to install an entire map on one kill (gasoline) or have 10 + additional jumps (feathers). Quite often the screen is filled with enemies that are either all dying en masse from your combination of items... or you're dead. Especially on Monsoon.
Not really much "story" going on here, but the music and art style creates a very brutal but beautiful space atmosphere.
Quite a new unique game that I'd recommend to anyone that likes 3rd person shooters or roguelikes.

Lots of fun, a bit of a learning curve, but the game is genuinely *fair* overall--even if early on it doesn't feel like it. It rewards your play time by improving you as a player. If the default game modes are either too hard or not quite to your liking, just unlock some Artifacts to change it up. Command and Sacrifice specifically change the way you play on a fundamental level to the point that you're almost playing a different game, but in a good way. The community Discord is quite friendly and helpful too, and the wiki is mostly accurate--enough to rely on for all the important things, even if a few nit-picky details are slightly off.

Multiplayer is a great strength and weakness of this game--it basically depends on who you play with. Some randos are extremely selfish and impatient, and they can make it a fairly miserable experience if you can't keep up. On the other hand, some people like to help out and show people the ropes. Hosting a game with a lobby name indicating your expectations can go a long way. For example, "Demons & Crabs Challenge" will have a totally different mindset than "20+ Stages." Just don't be one of those weirdos who leaves the default name on.

Lastly, don't be discouraged by the initial character select. Unlocking them isn't as hard as it seems, and is highly worth the effort.

Risk of Rain 2 is a phenomenal game. It's a rouge-like with smooth gameplay (unless you've looped a few times), great visual style, and a god tier soundtrack by Chris Christodoulou. There are 14 playable survivors including the dlc each with their own unique abilities that can greatly change how you play in a run. The game is highly replayable as a result. Time is difficulty in this game which means the longer you take to beat it the harder the game gets, which means the longer you are in a run the more enemies will be on screen with more damage and health which can cause your pc to stutter and have massive drops in FPS. You can also play online with up to 4 players. All in all though this game is incredibly fun and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2023 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Imagine this:
You come home from a long day at the office. You sit down in your special chair. You boot up Risk of Rain 2 for a quick session. You think, "I'll just play for maybe an hour and then I'll make dinner for the wife and kids" ... The game commences. After 20 hours of getting murdered by beetles, lizard people and rocks, you transcend and become the incarnated deity of this god forsaken planet. When you finally close the game due to exhaustion, you rise up from your chair. An odd smell fills your nasal cavity. What ever could this be? In the living room your family had succumbed to starvation some time ago . You have been immersed for six-weeks straight in this game. The police arrive as a result of neighbors complaining of incoherent shouting from your many losses over the weeks. You attempt to explain the situation to no avail. You are being framed for murder. You are convicted and sentenced to death, which is carried out 5-years later. Your last words to the warden before execution are as follows... "I can die today satisfied, for I once played god as you do now, Mr. Warden" ... You are now dead ... 

Moral of the story, become god. It is worth it

I had a couple friends who had it, and they said it was pretty good, so I got it. I was concerned by the cost, worried I was going to play it for 1 hour then never again. Almost 40 hours in, I can say that is not a problem. The game play loop is great and while it can get stale, they made sure to add as many ways to spice it up. Along with many different endings and just getting all the characters take a while, it is all very rewarding and you always feel like you are making progress. Not only that, but there are many ways to play it. Long range single target, hard to master melee, and great crowd control, everyone has a purpose and there is something for you. There is also not one thing that works, its all up to you. Great game, highly recommend. And get the dlc, its not a whole lot more and adds a lot trust me.

This game is addictive and God runs feel sublime. The stackability of all powerups turns you into a wreaking ball, but because the game throws ridiculous amounts of enemies, and later boss enemies at you to compensate, it makes you feel like, with all the havoc going on on screen, you could die anytime. Support this small team. They deserve every penny!

Honestly look like a nice hard roguelike at first but... even after getting slapped and choosing easy mode first, the thing is after the few characters you can decently unlock there is nothing else to do. The normal mode is a big finger in your face, you get rolled with no chance of this getting easier as the roguelike aspect only stands for each run, meaning the only skill can get you past normal. I can't even think hard mode is doable without a stupid amount of tears and blood. In and all, good ideas, well executed, but terribly balanced.

Edit: After giving a second chance to this game thanks to growing desire to play after seeing streaming of Risk of Rain Rebirth, I still can't recommend this game. Even after unlocking characters thanks to Wiki (as learning from playing is completely out of question with the kind of challenges required), most characters are as dull as the ones you get easily. The more objects you unlock, the more random runs are, making viable build terribly hard to get. The end boss level is unnecessarily huge forcing you to hope for movement perks. Further more, whatever the level you play at, the end boss battle is almost impossible for any close range characters with whom you can get wiped in a single slash. Honestly the whole experience of this game is terribly average. Very low fun, making this game not enjoyable to replay again and again. Uninstalling again, this time for good.

Rating: ★★★★★

Risk of Rain 2 is an absolute masterpiece that has captivated my gaming soul like no other. From the moment I stepped foot into the mystical world of Providence, I was hooked. The blend of intense action, strategic gameplay, and breathtaking visuals has made this rogue-lite treasure an instant favorite.

One of the standout features of Risk of Rain 2 is its seamless transition from a 2D platformer to a fully immersive 3D world. The developers have crafted an environment that feels alive, with each level teeming with intricate details and hidden secrets. The feeling of exploration is unmatched as I traverse stunning landscapes, all while battling hordes of monsters.

The game's diverse character roster is nothing short of extraordinary. Each survivor possesses a unique playstyle, allowing for endless hours of experimentation and strategic gameplay. Whether I'm trying to master the precise precision of the Huntress' skills or immersing myself in the sheer power of the Engineer's turrets, every moment feels fresh and exciting.

Risk of Rain 2 also boasts a rewarding progression system that kept me coming back for more. The rush I felt when unlocking new abilities and items is exhilarating, pushing me further into the perilous realms of the game. The synergy between various items creates an intricate web of strategies, ensuring that no two runs ever feel the same.

Multiplayer in Risk of Rain 2 is an absolute blast. Joining forces with friends to take on colossal bosses and overwhelming waves of enemies is an experience that words can hardly describe. The teamwork required to overcome these challenges fostered an intense sense of camaraderie and tested our ability to cooperate under pressure.

Furthermore, the game's stunning soundtrack adds an extra layer of immersion that elevates the overall experience. Each melody ingrains itself in your mind, perfectly complementing the chaos of battles and enhancing the sense of adventure.

In my humble opinion, Risk of Rain 2 is an absolute must-play for any gaming enthusiast. Its engrossing gameplay, stunning visuals, and addictive progression system make it a game that keeps on giving. I cherish every moment spent within its vibrant worlds and eagerly await each new update that expands upon its already magnificent universe.

So, if you're seeking an adrenaline-pumping adventure filled with endless excitement and opportunities for growth, Risk of Rain 2 is the game for you. Prepare to lose yourself in this masterfully crafted gem that will leave you yearning for more.)

I have good and bad feelings about this title. Well made, fun gameplay loop. Damage scaling on the hard mode "monsoon" is satisfying for about an hour, and then everything--and I mean *Everything*--Oneshots you. This paired with the frankly insulting death messages is not exactly a great time. 
I know, I know, theres a point to these death messages. However, like the meme comments they are inspired by, they remain mean-spirited. Play something else if you arent a masochist.
As a masochist, and one with thousands of hours on arguably harder games, I think there could be some polish on the base game that would bring serious shine. However the studio opted to have DLC.

Edit: played another 15+ hours of this game with the DLC. Made the game objectively worse. The litany of simply irritating enemies feel unbalanced to an even greater degree and the new items are. . . Ambitious? but poor. New lunar items are worst of all. Really disappointing.

Man, what to say about this game. It's come a long long way since I bought it, and since I last reviewed it, so I figured I'd rewrite my review, and I'm happy to say that in the time I've followed this game, It has only gotten better and better. The gameplay is just wonderful, and provides a good challenge even to good players, and the amount of content there is to unlock is crazy, from items, to enemy logs, to all the achievements, and the characters. Oh man the characters. Each and every one of the characters in this game feel completely different to play, all providing additional abilities to unlock over time, that completely change them so you almost never get bored. The level design is great, almost everywhere on every map is a wide open, yet beautiful space that feels fun to fight in. The maps, aside from being great to play on, also look great, and the art style really complements that. last but definitely not least, the soundtrack. Every song in this game is amazing, and I find myself often listening to the ost all the time. Overall, this game is an absolute steal if you like rougelites, and most people agree, is one of the better ones out there.

Update: Survivors of the void is amazing as expected, more great RoR2 with some twists. Highly recommend.

Update 2: Started modding the game, absolutely some of the most fun I've ever had in a game, also I can't wait for Seekers Of The Storm

Risk of Rain 2 is a spectacular game. Gameplay is addictive, with new items to find, characters to unlock, and other mysterious things to explore, the first 15 or so hours make you feel like you're constantly adapting the way you play. As you get more familiar with the games mechanics, the game turns to a quest for mastery, with unlockable alternate skills to change the gameplay of every survivor, special items trapped behind achievements, and lore books for every single "thing" in the game to find. Overall, the game is most certainly worth the full price, and is also often on sale, so don't wait, purchase Risk of Rain 2 today!

This game didn't initially click with me, it was almost too different from my over go-to roguelites and I kept struggling with the pace of game-play and finding the teleporter because I followed the advice of some terrible players on YouTube and spoiled my own fun.

Play on the standard difficulty until you understand the game, grab a few mods that actually tell you what the items do, and most importantly: YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO EVERY STAGE IN 3-5 MINUTES. The biggest Youtuber for this game is also straight up giving awful advice. Listen to the best players in the community, like Race - full looting is by far and away the most consistent method to getting wins in this game. Provided you're getting about an item a minute, you'll likely out-scale the enemies and win. It didn't take long with this method for me to play monsoon with all the characters and win my runs easily, and then the eclipse grind begins...

This game is actually a 10/10. The music, visuals, and moment to moment game-play is exquisite, and each character is so unique that it means that every run truly does feel different from the next. Also it has co-op, but I played solo.

Play with a keyboard and a mouse, it's easier. A genuine masterpiece and I can't wait for what's next.
